net.sf.ntru.sign

Class NtruSign

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.ntru.sign.NtruSign

  • public class NtruSign
extends java.lang.Object
    Signs, verifies data and generates key pairs.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      NtruSign(SignatureParameters params)
      Constructs a new instance with a set of signature parameters.

      Resets the engine for verifying a signature.

      • NtruSign

        public NtruSign(SignatureParameters params)
        Constructs a new instance with a set of signature parameters.
        Parameters:
        params - signature parameters

    • Method Detail

      • generateKeyPair

        public SignatureKeyPair generateKeyPair()
        Generates a new signature key pair. Uses up to B+1 threads if multiple processors are available.
        Returns:
        a key pair

      • generateKeyPairSingleThread

        public SignatureKeyPair generateKeyPairSingleThread()
        Generates a new signature key pair. Runs in a single thread.
        Returns:
        a key pair

      • initSign

        public void initSign(SignatureKeyPair kp)
        Resets the engine for signing a message.
        Parameters:
        kp -
        Throws:
        NtruException - if the JRE doesn't implement the specified hash algorithm

      • update

        public void update(byte[] m)
        Adds data to sign or verify.
        Parameters:
        m -
        Throws:
        NtruException - if initSign was not called

      • sign

        public byte[] sign(byte[] m)
        Adds data to sign and computes a signature over this data and any data previously added via update(byte[]).
        Parameters:
        m -
        Returns:
        a signature
        Throws:
        NtruException - if initSign was not called

      • sign

        public byte[] sign(byte[] m,
          SignatureKeyPair kp)
        Signs a message.
        This is a "one stop" method and does not require initSign to be called. Only the message supplied via the parameter m is signed, regardless of prior calls to update(byte[]).
        Parameters:
        m - the message to sign
        kp - a key pair (the public key is needed to ensure there are no signing failures)
        Returns:
        a signature
        Throws:
        NtruException - if the JRE doesn't implement the specified hash algorithm

      • initVerify

        public void initVerify(SignaturePublicKey pub)
        Resets the engine for verifying a signature.
        Parameters:
        pub - the public key to use in the verify(byte[]) step
        Throws:
        NtruException - if the JRE doesn't implement the specified hash algorithm

      • verify

        public boolean verify(byte[] sig)
        Verifies a signature for any data previously added via update(byte[]).
        Parameters:
        sig - a signature
        Returns:
        whether the signature is valid
        Throws:
        NtruException - if initVerify was not called

      • verify

        public boolean verify(byte[] m,
             byte[] sig,
             SignaturePublicKey pub)
        Verifies a signature.
        This is a "one stop" method and does not require initVerify to be called. Only the message supplied via the parameter m is signed, regardless of prior calls to update(byte[]).
        Parameters:
        m - the message to sign
        sig - the signature
        pub - a public key
        Returns:
        whether the signature is valid
        Throws:
        NtruException - if the JRE doesn't implement the specified hash algorithm
